info.title: EVRYTHNG REST API
info.description: The EVRYTHNG RESTful API for developers on the EVRYTHNG Platform.

get.description: Read key access information for the authenticating key.

200.description: The access information for the authenticating key.

post.description: Create a new access for another Application User.

get.description: Read an Application User's available acesses.

200.description: The list of available accesses.

delete.description: Delete an existing Application User access to revoke it. Either the granting or receiving user can do this.

get.description: Get all accounts visible to an Operator with their API key.

200.description: A list of all accessible accounts.

get.description: Read a single account by ID.

200.description: The requested AccountDocument, if available.

put.description: Update an account with new user information, such as new `customFields`.

200.description: The updated AccountDocument

get.description: Read an account's access information and current role.

200.description: An array of the account's accesses.

get.description: Read an account access by ID.

200.description: The access requested, if available.

put.description: Update an account access to set a new role.

200.description: The access was updated successfully.

get.description: Read all short domains available to an account.

200.description: An array of the account's short domains.

get.description: View rate limit information for the accounts.

200.description: The available rate limit information

post.description: Create a new action type.

get.description: Read all action types.  The action types are returned with the built-in types coming first, followed by the custom types sorted by descending creation date.

200.description: All available action types.

post.description: Create a new action of the specified type. `all` can be specified as the `actionType`, in which case the specified action type must be supplied in the payload. If no location is specified, the Platform will automatically determine the location based on the IP address of the device who has issued it, along with a country code that is returned in the context object.

get.summary: Read all actions of a type
get.description: Read all actions of the specified `actionType` visible to the authenticating API key. `all` can be used as the `actionType` to view actions of all types.

200.description: The actions of type requested, if available.

put.description: Update an action type with new metadata.

200.description: The action type was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete an action type.

200.description: The action type was deleted successfully.

get.description: Read a single action by ID. You can use `all` as an `actionType` to read actions of unknown type.

200.description: The requested action, if available.

delete.description: Delete an action by ID.

200.description: The action was deleted. No body is returned

get.description: Read a single action by ID with context. The `?context=true` query parameter can be used to include the context field in the action read.

200.description: The requested action, if available.

post.description: Create an application within a project. The object returned contains the `appApiKey` parameter, which is an Application API key that must be used within an external application to issue calls to the API. However, because this API key can be hard coded within external applications (e.g. mobile/JS) and is visible to anyone, it can be used only for a very limited set of operations (create users, read a product, send actions etc.).

201.description: The created application was created successfully.

application/json.name: Main App
application/json.description: Main app for API testing and documentation

get.description: Read all applications inside the specified project.

200.description: All visible applications.

application/json.name: Main App
application/json.description: Main app for API testing and documentation

get.description: Read an application by `applicationId` in the project specified by `projectId`.

200.description: The application requested, if available.

application/json.name: Main App
application/json.description: Main app for API testing and documentation

put.description: Update an application by `applicationId`.

200.description: The updated application

application/json.name: Main App
application/json.description: Main app for API testing and documentation

delete.description: Delete an application by `applicationId`.

200.description: The application was successfully deleted.

get.description: Read the self application of the authenticating Trusted App API Key.

200.description: The authenticating `ApplicationDocument`, if available.

put.description: Update the self application of the authenticating Trusted App API Key.

200.description: The application was updated.

get.description: Read the Trusted Application API key for the application with `applicationId`. This is a secret key that has access to more endpoints than the standard Application API key.

200.description: The Trusted Application API key.

post.description: Create a new unactivated Application User with a unique email address. The response contains an `activationCode` that must be returned to the API (See 'Activate an Application User') before it can access the API. This gives the client application an opportunity to ensure the email address has been validated.

201.description: The application user was created successfully.

post.description: Activate a new Application User using the `activationCode` provided in the 'Create an Application User' step.

201.description: The Application User was successfully activated.

post.description: Create an anonymous Application User. These users are not associated with a real person, and are useful for tracking anonymous interactions.

201.description: The anonymous user was created successfully.

get.description: Read all visible application users.

200.description: An array of all visible Application Users.

get.description: Read a single Application User but their `evrythngUser` ID.

200.description: The Application User was read successfully.

put.description: Update an existing Application User by their `evrythngUser` ID. Authorised Application Users can modify their own data (including the password) using their API key.

200.description: The Application User was updated.

delete.description: Delete an Application User by its `evrythngUser` ID.

200.description: The Application User was deleted.

post.description: Log an Application User out and invalidate their Application User API key.

201.description: The Application User was logged out successfully.

post.description: Authenticate (log in) an existing user using their original `email` and `password` used at creation time.

201.description: The user was logged in successfully, and a new API key created for this login session.

post.description: Log an Application User in and obtain access details.

200.description: The log in was successful.

post.description: Create a batch.

get.description: Read all available batches. Use a filter to retrieve a subset of all batches created.

200.description: An array of all available batches, paginated as necessary.

get.description: Read a single batch by ID.

200.description: The requested batch, if available.

put.description: Update a batch by ID. Nested fields such as `tags` are replaced with the new value in the payload.

200.description: The batch was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a batch by ID. Deleting the batch will not delete the tasks and Thngs in it, which must be deleted separately.

200.description: The batch was deleted successfully.

get.description: Read a list of connectors that are visible to the Application User authenticating this request with their Application User API Key.

200.description: A list of connectors available to the authenticating Application User.

get.description: Read a single connector by name as the authenticating Application User.

200.description: The requested connector, if available.

get.description: Authenticate the connector service through redirection.

301.description: Check the `Location` header for destination location.

post.description: Authenticate with the connector service using an existing OAuth token.

To enable a third party integration for a specific application, `POST` a connector model describing the configuration of the connection with the third party cloud. Only the Operator can enable connectors in an application. For Nest connectors, the `auth` credentials can be found in the Nest Developers console.

get.description: Read all connectors in an application.

200.description: All connectors within the specified application.

get.description: Read a single connector by name within an application.

200.description: The requested connector, if available.

put.description: Update a single connector by name. Not all the fields of a connector can be updated. If the authentication parameters changed, this is considered to be a new connector and it must to be created separately as a new resource.

200.description: The connector was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a single connector by name. Deleting a connector for an application will delete all the Thngs that were imported from the third party cloud.

200.description: The connector was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create a new collection. Resources can then be added to that collection with further `PUT` requests specifying the collection ID.

get.description: Read all collections available in an account.

200.description: A list of all visible collections.

get.description: Read a single collection by ID.

200.description: The collection requested, if available.

put.description: Update a collection by ID. Nested fields such as `tags` are replaced with the new version in the payload. There is a limit of 10,000 Thngs updated per API call on collections. If your collection contains more than 10,000 elements you should consider an iterative solution.

200.description: The collection was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a collection by ID.

200.description: The collection was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create an action on a collection.

get.description: Read all actions on a collection.

200.description: Array of all available actions on this collection.

get.description: Read an action on a collection by ID.

200.description: The requested action, if available.

post.description: Add collections to a collection.

200.description: The child collections were added successfully.

get.summary: Read all collections in a collections
get.description: Read all collections in a collection.

200.description: An array of all collections available.

delete.summary: Remove all collections in a collection
delete.description: Remove all collections from a parent collection.

200.description: The collections were successfully deleted from the parent collection.

delete.summary: Remove a collection from a collection
delete.description: Remove a collection from a parent collection.

200.description: The child collection was deleted from the parent successfully

put.description: Add Thngs to a collection. The maximum number of Thngs that can be added to a collection is 10,000 per request.

200.description: The Thngs were added successfully.

get.summary: Read all Thngs in a collection
get.description: Read all Thngs in a collection.

200.description: An array of Thngs in this collection, if any.

delete.summary: Remove all Thngs from a collection
delete.description: Remove all Thngs from a collection. Note that this does not delete the actual Thngs themselves.

200.description: All Thngs in the collection were deleted successfully.

delete.summary: Remove a Thng from a collection
delete.description: Remove a Thng from a collection. There is a limit of 500 Thngs removed per API call on collections. If your collection contains more than 500 elements you should consider an iterative solution.

200.description: The Thng was successfully deleted.

get.description: Read all domains available to an account.

200.description: An array of the account's domains.

post.description: Create remote file metadata. This operation is the basis for a remote file upload. A successful HTTP `POST` will create a `FileDocument` record with a unique ID and a transient `uploadUrl` field. This signed `uploadUrl` can then be used by a client with an HTTP `PUT` request to do the actual upload to remote storage. The `uploadUrl` will expire after 30 minutes. The input payload to this endpoint should also contain a setting for the `privateAccess` field to indicate whether the file should have 'private' or 'public' access on remote storage.

201.description: The file metadata was created successfully.

get.description: Read all remote file metadata items.

200.description: An array of all available remote file metadata items.

get.description: Read a single remote file metadata item by ID.

200.description: The remote file metadata item, if available.

delete.description: Delete a single remote file metadata item by ID.

200.description: The remote file metadata item was deleted.

post.description: Identify a 1D or 2D barcode from an uploaded image.

200.description: The request was accepted, and results may be returned.

get.description: Read a known identifier for its resource.

200.description: The request was accepted, and results may be returned.

post.description: Registers a new OAuth client.

201.description: The OAuth client was created successfully.

get.description: Read all registered OAuth clients in an application.

200.description: A list of all registered OAuth clients in scope.

get.description: Read a specific OAuth client by ID.

200.description: The requested OAuth client, if available.

put.description: Update an OAuth client by ID. As soon as the redirect URL is modified, the old URL is not used for a user's redirection.

200.description: The OAuthClientDocument was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete an OAuth client by ID. After the client is removed, it is not allowed to obtain the Application User access token anymore.

200.description: The OAuth client was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create a new place.

get.description: Read all places in an account, with an optional search origin and distance.

200.description: An array of all visible places in the account.

get.description: Read a place by ID.

200.description: The place that was requested, if available.

put.description: Update a place by ID. The old fields are entirely overwritten by the new values, so to add a tag for example you must submit the previous tag array including the new tags.

200.description: The place was read successfully.

delete.description: Delete a place by ID.

200.description: The place was successfully deleted.

post.description: Create a new policy to apply a schema to a role.

get.description: Read all policies for a given role ID.

200.description: A list of all available policies.

get.description: Read a single policy on a role by ID.

200.description: The requested policy, if available.

delete.description: Delete a single policy on a role by ID.

post.description: Create a new product. The ID returned can be then stored in the `product` field of any Thng in the platform, which denotes that that Thng is a unique instance of this particular product.

get.description: Read all products in the account.

200.description: An array of all products available.

get.description: Read a single product.

200.description: The product was read successfully.

put.description: Update a product by ID.

200.description: The product was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a product by ID. Deleting a product resource will remove its reference from all Thngs that point to it. This cannot be reversed!

200.description: The product was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create an action on a product.

get.description: Read all actions created on a product.

200.description: Array of all available actions on this product.

get.description: Read an action on a product by ID.

200.description: The requested action, if available.

post.description: Create a product's redirection.

get.description: Read a product's redirection.

200.description: The product's redirection, if it has one.

put.description: Update a product's redirection.

200.description: The redirection was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a product's redirection.

200.description: The product's redirection was deleted successfully.

put.description: Batch update Products with a `filter` query parameter.

post.description: Create a new project within an account.

get.description: Read all projects.

200.description: All projects in scope.

get.description: Read a project by ID

200.description: The requested project, if available.

put.description: Update a project by ID.

200.description: The updated project.

delete.description: Delete a project by ID. This action **cannot** be reversed!

200.description: The project was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create/update a product's properties. When a resource is created, you can specify an initial set of properties and their values. To update those properties or to add new ones, use a `PUT` request with an array of `PropertyDocument` JSON objects containing the changed fields. If the properties updated do not exist, they are created automatically by this request and no error/notification will be returned.

200.description: The property updates were applied successfully.

get.description: Read all properties on a product. The returned payload is the complete array of all the properties with the last value of each.

200.description: An array of properties of this product.

get.description: Read a single product property. By default, all the updates of this property are returned using pagination in a reverse history fashion (the first element of the returned array is the latest update). For accessing only a subset of all the updates to a single property, you can specify a time range using `?from=Timestamp` and `?to=Timestamp` to specify respectively the beginning and end of the time window. You will receive an array of all the property updates during this time.

200.description: The property was read successfully.

put.description: Update a single property by `key`.

200.description: The single property update was applied successfully.

delete.description: Delete a product property. Property updates are not uniquely identified (do not have their own URL). Therefore, the only way to delete data points is to append the `?to=Timestamp` URL query parameter to specify a point in time before which all the data points will be removed. If the `?to=` parameter is not specified, ALL updates of this property will be deleted!

200.description: The property was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create/update Thng properties. When a resource is created, you can specify an initial set of properties and their values. To update those properties or to add new ones, use a `PUT` request with an array of `PropertyDocument` JSON objects containing the changed fields. If the properties updated do not exist, they are created automatically by this request and no error/notification will be returned.

200.description: The property updates were applied successfully.

get.description: Read all properties on a Thng.

200.description: An array of properties of this Thng.

put.description: Update a single Thng property by `key`.

200.description: The single property update was applied successfully.

get.description: Read a single Thng property. By default, all the updates of this property are returned using pagination in a reverse history fashion (the first element of the returned array is the latest update). For accessing only a subset of all the updates to a single property, you can specify a time range using `?from=Timestamp` and `?to=Timestamp` to specify respectively the beginning and end of the time window. You will receive an array of all the property updates during this time.

200.description: The property was read successfully.

delete.description: Delete a Thng property. Property updates are not uniquely identified (do not have their own URL). Therefore, the only way to delete data points is to append the `?to=Timestamp` URL query parameter to specify a point in time before which all the data points will be removed. If the `?to=` parameter is not specified, ALL updates of this property will be deleted!

200.description: The property was deleted successfully.

put.description: Update the Reactor script for an application.

200.description: The Reactor script was updated successfully.

get.description: Read the Reactor script for an application by ID.

200.description: The Reactor script with associated metadata.

get.description: Read the status of a Reactor script update in progress.

200.description: The status of the Reactor script.

get.description: Read the Reactor logs.

200.description: Available Reactor logs.

application/json.message: Reactor script is about to execute. Function name: onScheduledEvent

delete.description: Delete the Reactor logs. To delete the Reactor logs of a specific log level you can use a `logLevel` filter.

200.description: The Reactor logs were successfully deleted.

post.description: Create a Reactor schedule document, describing how the schedule should behave.

201.description: The Reactor schedule was created successfully.

get.description: Read all Reactor schedules of the specified application.

200.description: An array of all available Reactor schedules.

get.description: Read a single Reactor schedule by ID.

200.description: An array of available Reactor schedules.

put.description: Update fields of an existing Reactor schedule by ID.

200.description: The Reactor schedule was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a Reactor schedule by ID. A one-shot scheduled event (using `executeAt` instead of `cron`) will be deleted after it has elapsed, and not assigned an ID.

200.description: The Reactor schedule was deleted successfully

get.description: Read the account-level Redirector.

200.description: The account's Redirector, if available.

put.description: Update the account Redirector. Created if it does not exist.

200.description: The account Redirector was updated successfully.

get.description: Read an application's Redirector.

200.description: The Redirector was read successfully.

put.description: Update the application Redirector. Will be created if it does not exist.

200.description: The application Redirector was updated successfully.

post.description: Create a new Application User role. Only the account owner can create new roles. You cannot create roles with the same `name` as the predefined `admin` and `none` roles. Roles `name`s are considered unique. This means two roles with different `id`s cannot share the same `name`.

201.description: The new role was created successfully.

application/json.name: Test Role
application/json.description: A role for the purposes of testing.

get.description: Read all available roles within the account.

200.description: An array of the available roles.

application/json.name: Test Role
application/json.description: A role for the purposes of testing.

get.description: Read a single role by ID.

200.description: The requested role, if available.

application/json.name: Test Role
application/json.description: A role for the purposes of testing.

put.description: Update a role by ID.

200.description: The role was updated successfully

application/json.name: Test Role
application/json.description: A role for the purposes of testing.

delete.description: Delete a role by ID. The predefined `none` role will be assigned to all the users currently having the role about to be removed. A `userInApp` role cannot be deleted until all users with that role have been assigned a different role.

200.description: The role was deleted successfully.

get.summary: Read an Application User role's permissions
get.description: Read an array of paths and access types that an Application User with the specified role can access.

200.description: The role's permitted paths and types of operations permitted.

put.description: Update the set of permissions for a role with a new set. The payload replaces the old set of permissions for this role. This must include any existing permissions, otherwise they will be deleted if not present in the new payload. To remove a permission, simply omit it in the payload after reading from the role initially.

200.description: The permissions were set successfully.

post.description: Create a new schema resource.

get.description: Read all schemas.

200.description: A list of all available schemas.

get.description: Read a single schema by ID.

200.description: The requested schema, if available.

put.description: Update a single schema by ID.

200.description: The schema was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a single schema by ID.

post.description: Create a task on the specified batch.

202.description: The new task was accepted. Check the `Location` header for the URL of the new task.

get.description: Read all tasks for a given batch.

200.description: All available tasks for this batch.

thngTemplate.name: Batch Thng
thngTemplate.description: A Thng born from a task on a batch

get.description: Read a single task for a given batch.

200.description: The requested task, if available.

get.description: Read the error logs, if any, for a given task. If not errors occured, there will be no logs.

200.description: The requested task logs, if any errors occured.

application/json.message: Failed to generate UrlBinding for [{shortId='IDF20170004', thng='Un7tb8bdMGPEY6wwahscxh6m', urlBinding='UnNtbsbAM3shY6aawhsyShMn'}]: uniqueness constraint violated.

post.description: Create a new Thng.

get.description: Read all Thngs.

200.description: An array of all available Thngs, paginated as required.

get.description: Read a single Thng by ID.

200.description: The requested Thng, if available.

put.description: Update a Thng by ID. Only the basic fields (`name`, `description`, `product`, `identifiers`, `tags`, and `customFields`) can be updated in this manner. Properties, location and collections must be updated via their respective `/thngs/:thngId/location`, `/thngs/:thngId/properties` and `/collections/:collectionId/thngs` endpoints.

200.description: The Thng was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a Thng by ID.

200.description: The Thng was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create a Thng's redirection.

get.description: Read a Thng's redirection.

200.description: The Thng's redirection, if it has one.

put.description: Update a Thng's redirection.

200.description: The redirection was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a Thng's redirection.

200.description: The Thng's redirection was deleted successfully.

put.description: Batch update Thngs with a filter query parameter.

get.description: Read a Thng's location history.

200.description: The Thng's location history.

put.description: Update a Thng's location. The payload must always be an array of `LocationDocument` objects, which allows you to send several locations (with different timestamps each) in a single request. This is useful when a device wants to update a path cached over a certain period of time at once. An example would be a taxi that updates the whole set of locations it has been through once per hour instead of sending each GPS sensor reading individually.

200.description: The Thng's location was updated successfully.

delete.description: Delete a Thng's location history. If the `?to=Timestamp` query parameter with timestamp is not specified, all history for this property will be deleted.

200.description: The location history was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create an action on a Thng.

get.description: Read all actions on a Thng.

200.description: Array of all available actions on this thng.

get.description: Read an action on a Thng by ID.

200.description: The requested action, if available.

post.description: Create a Device API key for a Thng to manage its own data. A Device API key can only be created by Application Users or Operators. If called multiple times for the same Thng, the existing API key will be returned (a new one will not be generated). If you want to create a new API key for a Thng, you must delete the existing one first.

201.description: The Device API key was created successfully.

get.description: Retrieve a Device API key with a Thng's ID.

200.description: The Device API key for this Thng, if it exists.

delete.description: Delete a Device API key to revoke access.

200.description: The Device API key was deleted successfully.

AccessDocument.description: An object representing an account's access record.

role.description: The ID of the currently assigned role.

AccountDocument.description: An object representing a Platform account.

tfaRequired.description: Whether two-factor authentication is required for this account.

AccountRedirectorRuleDocument.description: An object containing a single Redirector rule set.

match.description: Filter used to evaluate this rule. Will always match if this field is not set.

redirectUrl.description: URL to redirect to if the rule matches.

delegates.description: Array of app and/or project delegates that will receive this redirection if necessary.

constants.description: Key-value pairs (both must be strings). User can add as many as needed.

AccountRedirectorRulesDocument.description: An object representing the account's Redirector rules

rules.description: The rules set up for a Redirector.

ActionDocument.description: An object representing a Platform action.

user.description: The EVRYTHNG ID of the user who has performed this action.

createdByProject.description: The EVRYTHNG ID of the project who has performed this action.

thng.description: The EVRYTHNG ID of the Thng this action was carried out on.

product.description: The EVRYTHNG product ID associated with the Thng this action was carried out on.

collection.description: The EVRYTHNG ID of the collection this action was carried out on. Custom action types only.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the action took place. Filled automatically if unspecified.

locationSource.description: The method used to find the location where the action took place, and requires `location` to also be set. If a GPS was used (with user permission granted), `sensor` is specified. Otherwise an estimate is made based on the apparent location, which may not be the device itself.

reactions.description: An array of Redirector reactions that occured from this action.

ActionContextDocument.description: Object containing contextual data about the action creator.

ipAddress.description: The geolocation IP address of the action.

city.description: The geolocation city of the action, based on the IP address.

region.description: The wider region of the action.

userAgentName.description: The user agent name of the action creator's browser or other client.

operatingSystemName.description: Name of the action creator's client operating system.

timeZone.description: The timezone string, such as Europe/Paris

ActionTypeDocument.description: An object describing a custom action type.

name.description: The name of the action type. Custom action types must begin with an underscore.

ActivationCodeDocument.description: The payload for activating an unactivated Application User.

AddressDocument.description: An object representing a street address.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the address.

countryCode.description: The country code of the address.

buildingName.description: The building name of the address.

buildingFloor.description: The building floor of the address.

buildingRoom.description: The building room of the address.

buildingZone.description: The building zone of the address.

crossing1.description: The first crossing of the address.

crossing2.description: The second crossing of the address.

AnonymousUserDocument.description: An object representing an anonymous user.

evrythngUser.description: The Application User ID of this anonymous user.

email.description: The temporary email address assigned to the anonymous user.

evrythngApiKey.description: The API Key available to the anonymous user.

socialNetwork.description: The socialNetwork of the anonymous user.

ApplicationDocument.description: An object describing a platform application.

socialNetworks.description: An array of social networks that this application will support.

project.description: ID of the platform project this application belongs to.

defaultUrl.description: The URL where the default client app for this application is deployed.

appApiKey.description: The API key available to the application.

defaultRole.description: The default Application User role new Application Users created in this application will be given.

ApplicationRedirectorRuleDocument.description: An object containing a single Redirector rule set.

match.description: Filter used to evaluate this rule. Will always match if this field is not set.

redirectUrl.description: URL to redirect to if the rule matches.

constants.description: Key-value pairs (both must be strings). User can add as many as needed.

ApplicationRedirectorRulesDocument.description: An object representing an Application Redirector's rules.

rules.description: The rules set up for a Redirector.

ApplicationUserLoginDocument.description: An object representing an Application User login request.

email.description: The email address assigned to the Application User.

password.description: The Application User's password used at account creation time.

ApplicationUserLoggedInDocument.description: An object representing a logged in Application User.

evrythngUser.description: The Application User ID of this application user.

email.description: The email address assigned to the application user.

evrythngApiKey.description: The API key available to the application user.

socialNetwork.description: The socialNetwork of the application user.

ApplicationUserLogoutDocument.description: An object representing an Application User logout response.

logout.description: The status of the logout operation.

ApplicationUserAccessDocument.description: Object containing data relevant to an Application User's platform access.

project.description: The ID of the project the user belongs to.

app.description: The ID of the application the user belongs to.

role.description: The ID of the user's role.

apiKey.description: The actor's Application User API Key.

ApplicationUserDocument.description: An object describing an Application User.

email.description: E-mail address of the user. Unique within the app.

timezone.description: The current timezone for the user. For example: `Pacific/Honolulu` or `Europe/Uzhgorod`).

locale.description: The default language tag for the user, complied with RFC 5646.

project.description: The project ID of the application this user belongs to.

app.description: The ID of the application this user belongs to.

ApplicationUserActivationDocument.description: An object describing an Application User prior to activation.

evrythngUser.description: The ID of the Application User.

activationCode.description: The code to use to validate the user.

email.description: The email address of the new Application User.

ApplicationUserActivatedDocument.description: An object describing an Application User that has just been activated.

evrythngUser.description: The ID of the Application User.

status.description: The activation status of the user.

evrythngApiKey.description: The activated user's initial Application User API key.

ApplicationUserRoleDocument.description: An object describing a Platform role.

id.description: The role ID. May alse be 'none', 'admin', or 'base_app_user' default roles.

type.description: The type of Role. Only 'userInApp' is currently available.

ApplicationUserRolePermissionDocument.description: An object representing an account role permission. Depending on the type of role, different fields may be returned.

path.description: The API path the role can access. Must be a subset of the default `base_app_user` permissions.

access.description: A four letter combination of 'c', 'r', 'u', and 'd' describing the access to create, read, update, or destroy the resources in the 'path' of this permission.

AuthThngDocument.description: An object containing a Device API key and associated Thng ID. Used for both request and response.

thngId.description: The Thng ID to create a Device key for.

BatchDocument.description: An object representing a Platform batch.

resourceCountsByProduct.description: Count of resources, grouped by product ID. Those with no product come under `NO_PRODUCT`.

BasicTaskDocument.description: The minimum fields for any of the specific types of task.

inputParameters.description: One of the following types of `inputParameters`: `FixedAmountInputParametersDocument`, `FileBasedInputParametersDocument`, `ListBasedInputParametersDocument`, or `IdentifiersListBasedInputParametersDocument`.

accountId.description: The account this domain belongs to.

FixedAmountTaskDocument.description: A task for batch creation of Thngs with type `FIXED_AMOUNT`.

FileBasedTaskDocument.description: A task for batch creation of Thngs with type `FILE_BASED`.

ListBasedTaskDocument.description: A task for batch creation of Thngs with type `LIST_BASED`.

IdentifiersListBasedTaskDocument.description: A task for batch creation of Thngs with type `IDENTIFIERS_LIST_BASED`.

ReferenceImageDocument.description: Object representing an image recognition reference image.

name.description: Long name of the image resource.

ShortIdGenerationTaskDocument.description: A task for batch creation of short IDs.

CollectionDocument.description: An object representing a Platform collection, which can contain groups of Thngs.

collections.description: An array of collection IDs of any collections this collection belongs to.

ConnectorDocument.description: An object describing a Cloud 2 Cloud Connector Framework connector.

name.description: The unique name of the connector.

url.description: The url of the 3rd party service.

image.description: The location of an image associated with the 3rd party service.

authUrl.description: The authentication url for the 3rd party service.

ContributionsDocument.description: Object of keys for each contribution group, with resource counts as the value.

OutputParametersDocument.description: The output format for the task.

columns.description: The CSV columns to use. Valid values are 'SHORT_ID' and 'THNG'.

FixedAmountInputParametersDocument.description: Specification of the task input parameters for the `FIXED_AMOUNT` type.

FileBasedInputParametersDocument.description: Specification of the task input parameters for the `FILE_BASED` type.

location.description: The URL of the input file containing the list of short IDs. This must be a Files API uploaded URL.

format.description: The format of the input file referred to by `location`.

headers.description: Key-value object of HTTP headers required when requesting the input file.

ListBasedInputParametersDocument.description: Specification of the task input parameters for the `LIST_BASED` type.

IdentifiersListBasedInputParametersDocum.description: Specification of the task input parameters for the `IDENTIFIERS_LIST_BASED` type.

ShortIdGenerationInputParametersDocument.description: Input parameters for a Short ID Generation Task.

quantity.description: Amount of short IDs to generate.

FileDocument.description: An object containing remote file metadata.

uploadUrl.description: The URL to upload file data to with an HTTP `PUT` request. Will expire after 30 mins.

contentUrl.description: The URL the file is available at for download.

name.description: Name of the file. This is unique to the account, allowing a file to be overwritten.

type.description: The MIME type of the file. Must match the Content-Type header used when uploading the file content.

privateAccess.description: A boolean flag indicating whether a file should have `private` or `public` access on remote storage.

size.description: The size of the uploaded file in bytes.

GeoJSONPointDocument.description: A GeoJSON Point object. The coordinate order is longitude, then latitude.

KeyAccessDocument.description: Object describing the account and actor associated with a key

timestamp.description: The time the location update occurred, or filled automatically by the Platform if omitted.

RateLimitsDocument.description: Object containing API key rate limit information.

name.description: The name of the rate limit type.

SingleRateLimitField.description: A single set of rate limit information

hits.description: The number of hits so far since reset.

hitsRemaining.description: The remaining number of hits until reset.

reset.description: Number of seconds until rate limit reset.

timeFrame.description: The time frame of the rate limit.

depth.description: The rate limit path URL depth

logLevel.description: The level of the log message.

message.description: The content of the log entry.

NestModelDocument.description: Object representing the device connector model with the Nest API.

NestModelDevicesDocument.description: The device structures for Nest thermostats, smoke alarms, and cameras.

OAuthClientDocument.description: An object representing an OAuth client.

id.description: The ID of the OAuth client.

name.description: The name of the OAuth client.

redirectUrl.description: The OAuth redirect URL. Must be a valid absolute URL under HTTPS protocol.

clientId.description: The OAuth client ID for the 3rd party service.

clientSecret.description: The OAuth client secret for the 3rd party service.

oAuthUrl.description: The URL of the OAuth service.

tokenUrl.description: The URL of the OAuth service access token.

OAuthTokenDocument.description: Object containing an existing OAuth token to use with Cloud 2 Cloud.

name.description: Name of the specific role permission.

enabled.description: `true` if this permission is enabled, `false` otherwise.

projectScoped.description: `true` if this permission if enabled only for specific project(s), `false` otherwise.

projects.description: Array of project IDs that this permission is enabled for.

PlaceDocument.description: An object describing a real physical place with an address.

icon.description: URL to an image representing the place.

schema.description: ID of the schema to apply to this role.

role.description: ID of the role this policy applies to.

ProductDocument.description: An object representing a platform product.

activatedAt.description: Timestamp when the product was activated.

categories.description: An array of product categories as strings.

photos.description: An array of product photo URLs as strings.

url.description: The URL linking to the product information.

properties.description: A JSON object with key-value pairs describing properties of the product.

ProjectDocument.description: An object describing a platform project.

imageUrl.description: URL link to the image to use in the project properties view.

shortDomains.description: An array of short domains assigned for the project, for example: `tn.gg` by default.

PropertyDocument.description: An object representing a single property update. The `value` property may be a string or integer.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the property update.

ReactorActionCreatedDocument.description: The event parameter passed to an `onActionCreated` event callback.

ReactorThngPropertiesChangedDocument.description: The event parameter passed to an `onThngPropertiesChanged` event callback.

changes.description: Object containing a key for each changed property, with value of a `ReactorPropertyChangeDocument`.

ReactorProductPropertiesChangedDocument.description: The event parameter passed to an `onProductPropertiesChanged` event callback.

changes.description: Object containing a key for each changed property, with value of a `ReactorPropertyChangeDocument`.

ReactorScheduledEventDocument.description: Object as defined in the `ReactorScheduleDocument.event` field.

ReactorPropertyChangeDocument.description: Object describing the property changes for this event.

timestamp.description: The time that the update occured.

ReactorScheduleDocument.description: An object describing a Reactor schedule.

event.description: Object to be passed as the parameter to the callback when it is invoked.

function.description: The name of the exported function to invoke.

executeAt.description: Unix timestamp (milliseconds) describing when to execute the scheduled event.

cron.description: Cron expression describing the execution interval.

enabled.description: If the schedule is enabled. Defaults to `true`.

ReactorScriptDocument.description: Object containing a Reactor script and associated metadata.

manifest.description: The Reactor script manifest, in a format similar to Node's `package.json`.

ReactorScriptStatusDocument.description: Object describing the status of the Reactor script.

updating.description: If the Reactor script is updating at the moment.

error.description: Error message if failed to update the Reactor script.

evrythngUrl.description: The location of the EVRYTHNG resource.

evrythngId.description: The EVRYTHNG ID of the associated resource.

shortDomain.description: The associated short domain for the redirection.

shortId.description: The short ID of the redirection

type.description: The type of the associated EVRYTHNG resource.

hits.description: The number of times the redirection has been hit.

RedirectionResourceDocument.description: Container for a task generation short ID.

shortId.description: The short ID for the redirection.

TaskResultDocument.description: Description of the result of a batch task.

totalCount.description: The total count of generated resources.

totalThngsCreated.description: The total count of generated Thngs.

totalUrlBindingsCreated.description: The total count of generated redirections.

location.description: The URL of the result file.

error.description: The error message describing what went wrong.

RoleScopesDocument.description: The roles and projects scopes this role is scoped to.

roles.description: The roles this role is scoped to.

projects.description: The projects this role is scoped to.

resourceType.description: The type of resource this schema applies to.

jsonSchema.description: The JSON Schema description of the objects this schema will validate.

product.description: The product ID filter applied to Thngs compared to this schema. If `null`, the product ID filter is not applied.

ScanImageContentDocument.description: An object containing image data in Base 64 encoding.

ScanImageResultsDocument.description: Object containing the results of an image scan with the Identifier Recognition API.

users.description: An array of Application User IDs this resource is scoped to.

projects.description: An array of project IDs this resource is scoped to.

ShortIdTemplateDocument.description: An object representing a short ID generation task on a batch.

length.description: Full length of the short ID. Including separators, prefix, and suffix.

start.description: Value of the core of the first code generated.

increment.description: Increment of the core for subsequent codes generated.

padding.description: How to pad the sequence, in order to keep a fixed length.

paddingChar.description: Single character used to pad, if `padding` is `CHAR`.

prefix.description: Prefix in the short ID pattern.

suffix.description: Suffix in the short ID pattern.

separator.description: Separator between prefix and core, and core and suffix in the short ID pattern.

TaskLogDocument.description: A single task error log entry.

jobId.description: The ID of the task associated with this entry.

message.description: A description of the nature of the error.

thngIdentifier.description: Key-value pair of the Thng identifier.

urlBinding.description: ID of the URL binding for this Thng.

TaskProgressDocument.description: Description of the task progress in terms of individual contributions.

totalAmount.description: The total amount of generated resources so far.

TimeInfoDocument.description: Object describing the current time, with timezone info.

timestamp.description: Number of milliseconds since the Epoch.

TimeInfoTimezoneDocument.description: Object describing the current time, with timezone info.

timestamp.description: Number of milliseconds since the Epoch.

localTime.description: The date, time and zone offset specified as per ISO 8601.

nextChange.description: when the next change in offset is expected.

offset.description: The current offset in milliseconds of the timezone compared to UTC.

activatedAt.description: Timestamp when the Thng was activated.

product.description: The Platform ID of a product this Thng is a class of.

properties.description: A JSON object with key-value pairs describing properties of the Thng.

collections.description: An array of collection IDs of any collections this Thng belongs to.

AppUserStatusField.description: The activation status of the user.

BatchField.description: The ID of the batch of this task.

CreatedAtField.description: Timestamp when the resource was created.

CustomFieldsDocument.description: Object of case-sensititve key-value pairs of custom fields associated with the resource.

CustomIdentifierDocument.description: Object describing the custom identifier values for a single key.

values.description: The array of custom identifier values.

DefaultRedirectUrlField.description: The URL for the generated redirections. `{evrythngId}` can substitute the appropriate resource ID.

GenerateRedirectionsField.description: Whether redirections will be created as part of the task.

GenerateThngsField.description: Whether Thngs will be created as part of the task.

IdentifiersDocument.description: Various identifiers (EPC, ISBN, etc.) as a JSON object with one or more key-value pairs.

OutputParametersFormatField.description: The type of input or results file.

ShortDomainField.description: The short domain used for generated redirections.

ShortIdTemplateField.description: The template of the short ID format. Contains one field 'type' with only one permitted value 'THNG_ID'.

TagsField.description: Array of string tags associated with this resource.

TaskCompletedAtField.description: Time at which the task was completed.

TaskTypeField.description: The type of task to perform.

PopulatingTaskTypeField.description: The type of task to perform.

ShortIdGenerationTaskTypeField.description: The type of task to perform.

TriggerUserField.description: The triggering Application User, if any.

TriggerUserAnonymousField.description: `true` if the triggering Application User is anonymous, `false` otherwise.

UpdatedAtField.description: Timestamp when the resource was updated.

MaxDistance.name: maxDist
MaxDistance.description: The maximum distance from the query origin in kilometers.
